metadata.title: CVE-2024-39494 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ima: Fix use-after-free on a dentry's dname.name->d_name.name can change on rename and the earlier value can be freed;there are conditions sufficient to stabilize it (->d_lock on dentry,->d_lock on its parent, ->i_rwsem exclusive on the parent's inode,rename_lock), but none of those are met at any of the sites. Take a stablesnapshot of the name instead.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-39494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-260-generic - 4.4.0-260.294
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-260-generic - 4.4.0-260.294
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-260-lowlatency - 4.4.0-260.294
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-230-generic - 4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-230-generic - 4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-230-lowlatency - 4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1138-kvm - 4.4.0-1138.148
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1175-aws - 4.4.0-1175.190
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1174-aws - 4.15.0-1174.187~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1182-azure - 4.15.0-1182.197~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1167-gcp - 4.15.0-1167.184~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1136-oracle - 4.15.0-1136.147~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-260.294').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1138.148').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1175.190').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1174.187~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1182.197~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1106.113').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1167.184~16.04.2').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1136.147~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
